definitions: Each of the lines in which light (and heat) may seem to stream from the sun or any luminous body, or pass through a small opening.
The straight line in which light or other electromagnetic radiation travels to a given point.
A specified form of non-luminous radiation.
Sunlight considered in the context of sunbathing.
An initial or slight indication of a positive or welcome quality in a time of difficulty or trouble.
Any of a set of straight lines passing through one point.
A thing that is arranged radially.
Any of the individual strap-shaped florets around the edge of the flower of a daisy or related plant.
Each of the long slender bony supports in the fins of most bony fishes.
Each radial arm of a starfish.
